description: Details pursuant to the discharge of Condition 10 (Canal Access Ramp Details) as attached to planning permission ref. 75111/APP/2022/1007 dated 21.09.2021 (Full planning permission for site clearance and preparation, including the demolition of remaining buildings, and the redevelopment of the site to provide three energy centres, two visitor reception centres, a new footpath and cycleway link to the canal towpath, works to the highway, car parking, cycle parking, associated infrastructure, enclosures and necessary physical security systems, hard and soft landscaping, and ancillary uses, as well as associated external works).
site_name: Land at Bulls Bridge Industrial Estate
application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
decision_conditions: For the avoidance of doubt, the details show at the top left of approved drawing reference 'MWL-0471-SEW-GL-DR-L-100011 P11' shows the superseded canal access ramp design. The canal access ramp design details shown on the right side of approved drawing reference 'MWL-0471-SEW-GL-DR-L-100011 P11' are approved and are permitted for implementation in accordance with the requirements outlined Condition 10 (Canal Access Ramp Details) as attached to planning permission ref. 75111/APP/2022/1007.

The Canal and River Trust have advised that the shrub planting should be low-level and maintained as such, to avoid growing out over the towpath or at eye level to prevent lines of sight to the access point (especially for those approaching from the west under the road bridge). The Trust would be happy to provide details on our 'Share the Space' signage to add to the proposed signage for people joining the towpath down the ramp, and which could also be added to railings and the proposed signpost. The applicant/developer is advised to contact Susannah Miller, Enterprise Manager (Susannah.miller@canalrivertrust.org.uk) to discuss this further.

In addition, any works would need to adhere to the Trust's "Code of Practice for Works affecting the Canal & River Trust". The applicant/developer is advised to contact William Hardy, Infrastructure Works Engineer (William.hardy@canalrivertrust.org.uk) to discuss this further.
